---
title: The perception of Swedish housing owner’s on the strategies to increase the
  rate of energy efficient refurbishment of multi-family buildings
type: pub
encoding: UTF-8

---
<h1>Publikasjon</h1>
<article id="csl-bib-container-DWVEYCH7" class="csl-bib-container">
  <div class="csl-bib-body"> <div class="csl-entry">Myhren, J. A., Heier, J., Hugosson, M., &#38; Zhang, X. (2020). <div id="csl-bib-meta-DWVEYCH7" class="csl-bib-meta">
  <article id="about-article-DWVEYCH7" class="about_pub-article">
    <h1>Om</h1>
    Myhren et al. gjennomførte ein studie for å forstå kvifor svenske bustadeigarar er nølande til å gjennomføre energieffektive oppgraderingar av fleirfamiliebygningar. Dei fann at sjølv om eigarane er medvitne om nasjonale mål og ønskjer nye reguleringar velkomne, er oppussingsraten framleis låg. Eigarane er uroa over "ytingsgapet," som er skilnaden mellom forventa og faktisk energisparing. Dei ønskjer meir nøyaktige prognosar og bevis på at berekraftsmål kan oppnåast i praksis. Studien føreslår at eit nytt nasjonalt informasjonssenter kan hjelpe ved å dele suksessfulle døme på oppussingar, auke medvitet og oppmuntre fleire eigarar til å gjennomføre energieffektive prosjekt. Dette er viktig for å nå klima- og energimål i Sverige og EU.
  </article>
  <article id="keywords-article-DWVEYCH7" class="keywords-article">
    <h1>Emneord</h1>
    Energieffektiv oppussing, Fleirfamiliebygningar, Bustadeigarar, Ytingsgap, Nasjonale strategiar
  </article>
  <article id="abstract-article-DWVEYCH7" class="abstract-article">
    <h1>Samandrag</h1>
    Improving the energy performance of existing buildings is crucial for reaching both EU and national climate and energy targets. The main objective of this study was to map challenges that Swedish housing owners perceive when making energy-efficiency refurbishments. A secondary objective was to compare how well these challenges relate to national strategies. The study applied a combined methods approach with audience response meters and in-depth qualitative semi-structured interviews. The housing owners express the view that they have sufficient knowledge of national ambitions to improve the energy performance of buildings and welcome the new building regulations. Despite this supposed knowledge and the current economic situation with beneficial loans, the refurbishment rate still remains low. The housing owners explain that they are concerned about the ‘performance gap’ and request more accurate energy performance predictions. They are also waiting for proof that all sustainability goals can be reached in reality. Probably, too few projects fulfilling ambitions in all categories: economically, socially and energy-wise have been followed up and demonstrated nationally. The new national information centre on refurbishment of buildings may help to spread information about such projects, raise awareness and thus increase the refurbishment rate.
  </article>
